newsitem.title: POLAND: Bomb kills man at war veterans meeting in Poland.
newsitem.headline: Bomb kills man at war veterans meeting in Poland.

text.p: A bomb exploded on Thursday at a small town gathering in Poland of veterans marking the anniversary of the end of World War Two, killing a 72-year-old man and wounding several people, police said.

The device went off under a table at which 50 ex-combatants were seated in the southwestern town of Rudna Gwizdanow. The blast killed the man nearest to it and badly mutilated his body, a police duty officer in nearby Legnica told Reuters.
"One person is badly wounded and others injured to various degrees...three may have to be hospitalised," said the officer, who asked not to be named.
He said it was possible the dead man may have planted the device himself, adding: "There is no information on what may have been the motive for this act."
